children.name: PropertyBuilder(InternalPropertyBuilder)
children.summary:
<para>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Builders.PropertyBuilder"></xref> class to configure a given
property.
</para>
<para>
Instances of this class are returned from methods when using the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref> API
and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
</para>

parameters.description: Internal builder for the property being configured.

syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Metadata As IMutableProperty

type.name: IMutableProperty
type.summary:
<para>
Represents a scalar property of an entity.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IProperty"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

children.name: IInfrastructure<IMutableModel>.Instance
children.summary: The model that the property belongs to.

syntax.content.vb: ReadOnly WriteOnly Property Microsoft.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.IInfrastructure<Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableModel>.Instance As IMutableModel Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel).Instance

type.name: IMutableModel
type.summary:
<para>
Metadata about the shape of entities, the relationships between them, and how they map to the database. A model is typically
created by overriding the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContext.OnConfiguring(Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContextOptionsBuilder)"></xref> method on a derived context, or
using <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IModel"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

children.name: IInfrastructure<InternalPropertyBuilder>.Instance
children.summary: The internal builder being used to configure the property.

syntax.content.vb: ReadOnly WriteOnly Property Microsoft.Data.Entity.Infrastructure.IInfrastructure<Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Internal.InternalPropertyBuilder>.Instance As InternalPropertyBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of InternalPropertyBuilder).Instance

children.name: HasAnnotation(String, Object)
children.summary:
Adds or updates an annotation on the property. If an annotation with the key specified in

already exists it's value will be updated.

syntax.content: public virtual PropertyBuilder HasAnnotation(string annotation, object value)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function HasAnnotation(annotation As String, value As Object) As PropertyBuilder

parameters.description: The key of the annotation to be added or updated.
The value to be stored in the annotation.

type.name: PropertyBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Internal.Property"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
Instances of this class are returned from methods when using the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref> API
and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Class PropertyBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel), IInfrastructure(Of InternalPropertyBuilder)

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: HasMaxLength(Int32)
children.summary: Configures the maximum length of data that can be stored in this property. Maximum length can only be set on array properties (including properties).

syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function HasMaxLength(maxLength As Integer) As PropertyBuilder

parameters.description: The maximum length of data allowed in the property.

type.name: PropertyBuilder
type.summary:
<para>

</para>
<para>

and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Class PropertyBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel), IInfrastructure(Of InternalPropertyBuilder)

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: IsConcurrencyToken(Boolean)
children.summary: Configures whether this property should be used as a concurrency token. When a property is configured as a concurrency token the value in the database will be checked when an instance of this entity type is updated or deleted during to ensure it has not changed since the instance was retrieved from the database. If it has changed, an exception will be thrown and the changes will not be applied to the database.

syntax.content: public virtual PropertyBuilder IsConcurrencyToken(bool concurrencyToken = true)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function IsConcurrencyToken(concurrencyToken As Boolean = True) As PropertyBuilder

parameters.description: A value indicating whether this property is a concurrency token.

children.name: IsRequired(Boolean)
children.summary: Configures whether this property must have a value assigned or whether null is a valid value. A property can only be configured as non-required if it is based on a CLR type that can be assigned null.

syntax.content: public virtual PropertyBuilder IsRequired(bool required = true)
syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function IsRequired(required As Boolean = True) As PropertyBuilder

parameters.description: A value indicating whether the property is required.

children.name: ValueGeneratedNever()
children.summary: Configures a property to never have a value generated when an instance of this entity type is saved.
children.remarks: Note that temporary values may still be generated for use internally before a new entity is saved.

syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function ValueGeneratedNever As PropertyBuilder

type.name: PropertyBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Internal.Property"></xref>.
</para>
<para>

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: ValueGeneratedOnAdd()
children.summary: Configures a property to have a value generated only when saving a new entity, unless a non-null, non-temporary value has been set, in which case the set value will be saved instead. The value may be generated by a client-side value generator or may be generated by the database as part of saving the entity.

syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function ValueGeneratedOnAdd As PropertyBuilder

type.name: PropertyBuilder
type.summary:
<para>
Provides a simple API for configuring a <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.Internal.Property"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
Instances of this class are returned from methods when using the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref> API
and it is not designed to be directly constructed in your application code.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Public Class PropertyBuilder Implements IInfrastructure(Of IMutableModel), IInfrastructure(Of InternalPropertyBuilder)

return.description: The same builder instance so that multiple configuration calls can be chained.

children.name: ValueGeneratedOnAddOrUpdate()
children.summary: Configures a property to have a value generated only when saving a new or existing entity, unless a non-null, non-temporary value has been set for a new entity, or the existing property value has been modified for an existing entity, in which case the set value will be saved instead.

syntax.content.vb: Public Overridable Function ValueGeneratedOnAddOrUpdate As PropertyBuilder
